com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.engine.optimizer.core
Class BasicPatternJoin

java.lang.Object
  com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.engine.optimizer.core.BasicPatternJoin

public class BasicPatternJoin
extends java.lang.Object

The class implements a number of operation applicable on joined triple patterns (BGP)

Author:
Markus Stocker

isJoined

public static boolean isJoined(GraphNode node1,
                               GraphNode node2)
The method returns true if two GraphNodes are joined, because of matching S/P/O. The method returns true, if one of the nine possible combinations matches.

Parameters:
node1 -
node2 -
Returns:
boolean

                               com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)

specificTypes

public static java.util.List specificTypes(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple1,
                                           com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method returns a list of join types defined for two triples. The specific types are identified, i.e. the method differentiates between bound and unbound joins.

Parameters:
triple1 -
triple2 -
Returns:
List

specificType

public static java.lang.String specificType(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple1,
                                            com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method returns the first identified join type between the triples. The specific type is identified, i.e. the method differentiates between bound and unbound joins. If the triple patterns are not joined, the method returns null.

Parameters:
triple1 -
triple2 -
Returns:
String

specificTypeIgnorePP

public static java.lang.String specificTypeIgnorePP(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple1,
                                                    com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method returns the first identified join type between the triples, ignoring the specific uPP or bPP join type.

Parameters:

triple2 -

                                          com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method returns generic types, i.e. it doesn't consider if the joins are bound or unbound.

genericType

public static java.lang.String genericType(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple1,
                                           com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method returns the first identified generic join type, i.e. it doesn't consider if the joins are bound or unbound. If the patterns are not joine, the method returns null.
